tooltip.title: Template Code
tooltip.content: Auto-generated unique code (e.g., SCRUTINY_TEMPLATE_123456). Used for referencing in automation and reports. Click sparkle icon to regenerate.

fields.label: Template Title
fields.explanation: Descriptive name shown in template lists

tooltip.title: Template Title
tooltip.content: Human-friendly name that appears in selection lists. Use clear, descriptive titles like 'GST Scrutiny Response Letter' or 'Demand Notice Reply'.

tooltip.title: Case Stage
tooltip.content: The litigation stage this template is designed for. Templates are organized and filtered by stage for easier discovery.

tooltip.title: Template Version
tooltip.content: Version number tracks template changes. System automatically increments when you save modifications.

fields.label: Visibility
fields.explanation: Who can see and use this template

tooltip.title: Template Visibility
tooltip.content: Admin: Only administrators. Team: All team members. All: Everyone including clients (use with caution).

tooltip.title: Template Editor
tooltip.content: Create document content with rich formatting. Use toolbar for bold, italic, lists, tables, alignment. Insert {{variables}} from the sidebar.

fields.label: Insert Variables
fields.explanation: Dynamic fields auto-filled from case data

tooltip.title: Variable Library
tooltip.content: Click any variable to insert into your template. Variables like {{client_name}} or {{case_number}} are replaced with actual data when generating documents.

fields.label: Field Library
fields.explanation: Available data fields from your system

tooltip.title: Field Library
tooltip.content: Pre-defined fields from your case management system. Click + to add fields to your template and automatically insert them into the editor.

tooltip.title: Add Field to Template
tooltip.content: Adds the field to your template's field list and inserts the variable into the editor at cursor position.

tooltip.title: Company Logo
tooltip.content: Upload your firm's logo (PNG, JPG, max 2MB). Appears in document header when enabled. Recommended size: 200x80px.

fields.label: Header Text
fields.explanation: Text appearing at top of every page

tooltip.title: Document Header
tooltip.content: Text displayed at the top of every page. Typically includes firm name and practice area. Shows below logo if uploaded.

fields.label: Footer Text
fields.explanation: Text appearing at bottom of every page

tooltip.title: Document Footer
tooltip.content: Text displayed at the bottom of every page. Common uses: confidentiality notices, firm contact info, disclaimer.

tooltip.title: Document Watermark
tooltip.content: Enable to display 'CONFIDENTIAL' watermark diagonally across pages. Adjust opacity slider to control visibility (10-50% recommended).

tooltip.title: Document Font
tooltip.content: Choose the font for your document. Inter and Roboto are recommended for professional legal documents. Font applies to all body text.

fields.label: Brand Colors
fields.explanation: Primary and accent colors for document

tooltip.title: Brand Colors
tooltip.content: Primary color: Used for headers and important elements. Accent color: Used for highlights and secondary elements. Pick colors matching your firm's branding.

tooltip.title: Output Format
tooltip.content: PDF: Best for final documents, cannot be edited. DOCX: Editable Word format. HTML: Web-viewable format. PDF is recommended for legal documents.

tooltip.title: Page Size
tooltip.content: A4: International standard (210x297mm). Letter: US standard (8.5x11in). Legal: US legal size (8.5x14in). Choose based on your jurisdiction.

tooltip.title: Page Orientation
tooltip.content: Portrait: Standard vertical orientation for most documents. Landscape: Horizontal orientation, useful for wide tables or charts.

tooltip.title: Page Margins
tooltip.content: Set margins in millimeters for each edge. Standard: 20mm all sides. Wider margins (25-30mm) provide more white space for binding or notes.

tooltip.title: Header/Footer Options
tooltip.content: Toggle to include/exclude header, footer, and page numbers. Disable for shorter documents or when not needed.

tooltip.title: Filename Pattern
tooltip.content: Use variables to create dynamic filenames. Example: ${code}_${case.caseNumber}_${now:YYYYMMDD}.pdf generates 'SCRUTINY_GST001_20251012.pdf'. Variables: ${code}, ${case.caseNumber}, ${now:format}.

tooltip.title: DOCX Template Upload
tooltip.content: Upload existing Word templates with {{placeholder}} variables (max 10MB). System detects variables and maps them to case data fields. Preserves formatting.

tooltip.title: JSON Import/Export
tooltip.content: Export: Download template as JSON for backup or sharing. Import: Restore template from JSON file. Useful for template versioning and team collaboration.

tooltip.title: Save Template
tooltip.content: Saves template to your library. Required fields: Template Code, Title, Stage. Template becomes available for document generation immediately.

buttons.label: Preview
buttons.explanation: See how document looks with sample data

tooltip.title: Preview Document
tooltip.content: Renders template with mock case data to show final appearance. All {{variables}} are replaced with sample values. Check formatting before saving.

tooltip.title: Generate Template Code
tooltip.content: Automatically creates unique template code based on stage and timestamp. Recommended to ensure no conflicts with existing templates.

features.label: Template Builder 2.0
features.explanation: Unified interface for creating all template types

tooltip.title: Template Builder 2.0
tooltip.content: All-in-one tool for creating rich text templates, field-based forms, or importing DOCX files. Features visual editor, variable library, branding controls, and output settings in a single workflow.

tooltip.title: Document GST Case Progress
tooltip.content: Record specific work done for this GST litigation task. Include form references when relevant (e.g., 'ASMT-10 reply drafted addressing 3 key objections', 'DRC-01 review completed - liability confirmed at â‚¹2.4L', 'Form GSTR-9C reconciliation in progress'). Be detailed enough for handoff to other team members.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter progress remarks for GST case

fields.label: Outcome
fields.explanation: Current status of this GST work activity

tooltip.title: Outcome Types for GST Cases
tooltip.content: Progressing: GST work moving forward smoothly (e.g., reply drafting on track). Blocked: Cannot proceed due to external factors (e.g., awaiting client GSTR data). Completed: This GST work item is finished (e.g., notice reply filed). Need Support: Require help from team (e.g., section reference verification). Pending Input: Waiting for client/department response (e.g., missing GST invoices).

accessibility.ariaLabel: Select outcome type for GST work

fields.label: Task Status
fields.explanation: Update the overall GST task progress state

tooltip.title: GST Task Status Updates
tooltip.content: Updates the parent GST task's current state. Not Started: No work begun on GST matter. In Progress: Actively working on GST case (e.g., drafting ASMT-10 reply). Review: GST work ready for partner review. Completed: GST task fully finished (e.g., appeal filed). Overdue: Passed GST authority deadline. Updates reflect in task lists and GST dashboards.

fields.label: Hours Worked
fields.explanation: Time spent on this GST activity (optional)

tooltip.title: Time Tracking for GST Work
tooltip.content: Record time spent on GST case in hours (e.g., 0.25 = 15 mins for quick notice review, 1.5 = 1hr 30mins for detailed ASMT-10 reply). Used for GST matter billing, workload analysis, and project time estimation. Leave blank if time tracking not required. Maximum 24 hours per entry.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter hours worked on GST case

fields.label: Work Date
fields.explanation: When was this GST work performed?

tooltip.title: GST Work Date vs Entry Date
tooltip.content: Date when GST work was actually performed (defaults to today). Use this to log GST work from previous days (up to 30 days back) - e.g., backdating hearing attendance or client meeting. Important for accurate GST billing and compliance tracking. The system records entry date separately for audit purposes.

fields.label: Next Follow-Up Date
fields.explanation: Schedule when to check this GST task again (optional)

tooltip.title: GST Follow-Up Reminders
tooltip.content: Set a future date when this GST task needs attention again (e.g., DRC-07 submission deadline, hearing date preparation reminder). Creates a reminder for the assigned person. Use quick buttons (Tomorrow, 3 days, 1 week) for common intervals. Leave blank if no specific GST follow-up needed. Appears in 'Pending GST Follow-ups' dashboard.

fields.label: Next Actions
fields.explanation: What GST work needs to be done next? (optional)

tooltip.title: Defining Next Steps in GST Cases
tooltip.content: Outline specific GST actions required to move task forward. Examples: 'Schedule client meeting to discuss GST liability implications', 'Draft response to objections 4-7 in ASMT-10 notice', 'Obtain partner approval for Section 73 defence strategy', 'Prepare annexures for DRC-01 submission'. Helps GST team members pick up where you left off.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter next actions for GST case

tooltip.title: GST Case Blockers
tooltip.content: Document obstacles preventing GST case progress. Examples: 'Waiting for client to provide GSTR-1 data for period April-June 2024', 'Need GST department clarification on Section 73 applicability', 'Missing Form DRC-01 acknowledgement from portal', 'Tax consultant unavailable until hearing date'. Helps identify bottlenecks in GST workflows and prioritize resolution.

accessibility.ariaLabel: Enter GST case blockers or issues

fields.label: Support Needed
fields.explanation: Mark if you need GST team assistance

tooltip.title: Request GST Team Support
tooltip.content: Flags the task on the Team Dashboard to request assistance on GST matter (e.g., section reference check for ASMT-10 reply, annexure preparation for DRC-07, GST portal navigation help). Task creator and team leads receive notification. Use for technical GST questions or workload assistance.

fields.label: Request Escalation
fields.explanation: Alert task creator about critical GST issues

tooltip.title: GST Case Escalation
tooltip.content: Notifies the task creator for urgent attention on GST matter (e.g., DRC-07 due date risk, missed hearing date correction needed, client non-cooperation affecting GST compliance). Sends immediate notification. Task marked with red flag. Use for critical GST deadline risks or client emergencies.

fields.label: Client Communication
fields.explanation: Mark if you contacted client about GST case

tooltip.title: GST Client Communication Tracking
tooltip.content: Check when you have contacted client (call/email/meeting) about GST matter. Logs a touchpoint on case timeline for GST engagement tracking. Examples: 'Discussed GST liability implications', 'Explained ASMT-10 notice objections', 'Requested missing GSTR-1 data'. Shows phone icon on timeline.

fields.label: Internal Review
fields.explanation: Mark if GST work was peer-reviewed

tooltip.title: GST Quality Assurance
tooltip.content: Mark when peer/partner has completed internal review (quality badge) before submitting GST reply/appeal. Examples: 'Partner reviewed ASMT-10 reply', 'Senior reviewed Section 73 defence strategy', 'Quality check on DRC-07 calculations'. Indicates GST work met internal standards.

tooltip.title: Progress Section
tooltip.content: Core section for recording work performed. Remarks field is required (min 20 chars) and forms the main record of progress. Outcome and Status updates provide at-a-glance health indicators for dashboards and reports.

tooltip.title: Time Tracking & Scheduling
tooltip.content: Log hours worked for billing and analytics. Set work date if logging past work (up to 30 days). Schedule next follow-up to create automatic reminders. All fields optional but recommended for accurate project tracking.

tooltip.title: Next Actions & Blockers
tooltip.content: Define clear next steps so anyone can continue work. Document blockers to make issues visible to management. Both fields optional but highly recommended for team coordination and project continuity.

tooltip.title: Follow-Up Flags
tooltip.content: Four optional flags for specific scenarios: Support Needed (team help), Escalation (urgent issues to creator), Client Interaction (contact logged), Internal Review (QA completed). Each triggers specific workflows and notifications. Use strategically.

buttons.label: Add Follow-Up
buttons.explanation: Save this follow-up to task history

tooltip.title: Save Follow-Up
tooltip.content: Saves follow-up entry to task history. Updates task status if changed. Sends notifications based on flags (escalation, support needed). Creates next follow-up reminder if date set. Disabled until remarks field has 20+ characters.

features.label: Add New Follow-Up
features.explanation: Record progress, track time, and coordinate with team

tooltip.title: Follow-Up System Overview
tooltip.content: Follow-ups create a detailed activity log for each task. Required: Progress remarks (20+ chars) and status update. Optional: Time tracking, next actions, blockers, and coordination flags. All entries timestamped and attributed to you. Visible in task timeline and analytics.
